questions.question: Choose the best option: I ____ my keys, can you help me look for them?
questions.explanation: Present perfect for a recent result relevant now.

questions.question: By the time we arrived, the film ____.
questions.explanation: Past perfect before a past point.

questions.question: We ____ dinner when the doorbell rang.
questions.explanation: Past continuous for interrupted background action.

questions.question: Next month, I ____ here for two years.
questions.explanation: Future perfect for duration until a future point.

questions.question: He usually ____ to school, but today he ____ the bus.
Fill in: I wish I ____ (know) the answer.
Fill in: If only she ____ (not/spend) so much time on her phone!
questions.explanation: If only + past for present regret.

questions.question: While he ____ along the beach, he ____ a strange shell.
Fill in: She has been ____ (study) English since grade 4.
Choose the correct tense: I promise I ____ you as soon as I arrive.
questions.explanation: After 'as soon as' future meaning uses present simple.

questions.question: By the end of this week, they ____ the app.
Rewrite with past perfect: We ate. Then we went out. → We ____ out after we ____ .
questions.explanation: Past perfect for earlier past action.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
options: I have been seeing him yesterday.
questions.explanation: Past simple with finished past time.
